intro: Ebelingia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions and has lanceolate leaves with a rough texture. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of Ethiopian flora.
